text: Pours a slightly chill-hazed yellow from the bottle with bubbly white head that leaves light lace. Aroma and taste of traditional lager yeast, mild earth, and a nice malty backbone. Good balance, easy drinker, solid for the style.

Draught pint at The Rock in Beloit, WI, October 29th. Very clear medium gold with a fully lasting smallish snow-white head...reasonably expressive malt-forward lightly sweet aroma, touches of dry hay and thistle and thyme but overall subtle and with the accent always on the grain...body is a little more hoppy that I might have expected from that sweetish nose, though there is just a bit of residual sugar here at the front and that helps the strong noble hop character (just 24 IBU? really?) to keep the bittering even at the finish well within expected norms; unlike say the Surly Hell this never feels like anything but what it is...on the palate it is alas a bit flaccid, not quite watery but just above water; carbonation level is right on. While I liked this a lot overall it just doesnt quite measure up to the top examples Ive had; given how much I like the style and that there arent many great choices available to me here though, Im sure Ill be having it again.
Excellent helles lager. Great body with mild floral hop aroma and breadiness. LIke three floyuds lagers a lot.

Gold, with 2" of poofy head. Aroma is sweet, with a light hop buzz. Taste is mild, with slight biscuit, and its like an underflavored macro. This is not something you put in a 22 oz bottle. Thanks, Janet, but this was a waste of money.

22. Thanks, C! So much fun cracking these last night. Pours a slightly hazy medium gold with a loose whitish head. Big grassy nose, very dimensional, crystal clear, and balanced. Just what you want for any beer. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Nutty, grassy mid-palate, goes a bit dry, then finishes with a big wallop of dryness. Lovely and refreshing.

Cloudy dark gold pour with a thin white head. Aroma is sweet cereal, toast, bread, and spicy and floral hops. Flavor is sweet cereal, toast, biscuit, pale caramel, hay, spicy, grassy and dusty floral hops. Medium body, dry, slightly oily feel, medium carbonation. Good stuff.

650 mL bottle. Light golden body. Clear. Smells bready and of light German hops. A little bit of fruitiness. Tastes equally bready. A little bit of fruity sweetness. Low hop bitterness. Could use a little more bite. Clean finish. Light body. Not a bad take, but Im looking for something a bit more flavorful.
Aroma is a little skunky with corn. Good for what it is though - a nice, sweet lager.

Pours clear blonde with thin lacing, very little head. Aroma is honey, grape, mildly bready, white pepper. Taste is similar, some biscuit, honey, lemongrass, white pepper. Glad I tried it, cuz its 3F, but I wont buy it again.

65 cl bottle, Ann Arbor, MI, USA via three Floyds. Hazy gold, thin head. Great citrus aroma, lime and white pepper. Sweet but not overly. Honey with a mild spice. More white pepper on the finish. Great for the style.

Bomber from Savor Growl (if I remember correctly): murky gold pour with thin lightly frothy white head. aroma of grain, grass, honey. tastes are vague - creamy, drinkable, crisp - but no specifics other than light bready grain pop out. not sure if thats a complement or insult. get a little spice late. texture is nice creamy and lively. strange - nondescript but pleasant.

Great for the style, but just not my liking in a beer. semi sweet with a prune / grape flavor. sort of wheaty. pours light yellow with a 3 finger thick head on top. had a draft at jerrys in andersonville.

Bottled July 1, 2015 enjoyed July 30, 2015 in a 22 oz glass. 

Look - Light yellow. Stream out of bottle was almost clear. Even with an aggressive pour halfway through it not very much head. White head. Head did replenish itself, was never gone. What can I say, it looks like your dads beer.

Smell - Yeast. Malt. Barley. Light sweetness. Faint fruit. What can I say, it smells like your dads beer. 

Taste - Light bubblegum but guess what, your dads beer. 

Feel - Little more than normal alcohol burn. Not bitter with hops. Carbonation is there. Light bodied. 

Overall - Do you have those friends that drink Coors Light and gag at a stout or IPA and no matter how you tell them that they will come to love craft beer as they did regular beer, they drink Coors Light? Well, have them drink this. It will make them feel special. Good beer (I say this with a Coors Light inflatable over head).
Golden yellow body with a thin white cap. Aromas of yeast, light fruitiness, bready malts. German style lager. Light bodied and easy drinking. Pretty good.
Bottle courtesy of Mtt, thanks! Clear bright yellow color, white head. Aroma of subtle white pepper, straw. Taste is peppery , light hay and straw. Decent example of the style.

Yellow-gold pour with dissipating head. Lightly sweet and bready aroma; flavor of yeast, banana, light citrus notes, medium carbonation. A little biased to the Great Lakes dort, but still okay. Much more sweet, this one is.
Straw, lemon, and citrus and wheat aroma. Peppery spiced wheat with some light hop straw and lemon bite on the finish.

Pour on tap, clear golden pour with white head, aroma brought notes of bread, biscuit, some grain, lemony notes into a bit of yeast, dough, some slight hay and cereal notes. Taste was a mix of cereal, grain, bread into some biscuit, yeast, dough with a slight grassy note, finishing slightly dry, slightly sweet.

Bottle to goblet
Wheat, lemon, hay, pepper. Clear amber, thin creamy white head. Hay, lemon, malt.

taster on tap @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Slight haze in a light amber, thin white head cover, dots of lace. Taste is wheat and malt that stays dry all the way to a mildly bittered finish. Very light to the pount of being watery. Nothing wrong, because there isnt enough to have anything wrong.

Helles  
ピルスナーみ&
Not a bad beer. was enjoyable. typically not a lager fan but this wasnt too spicy or weird.

Look: pours a golden straw color. Bright white head. Thick and pillowy head. Very clear.
Smell: malty. Bread. 
Taste: malt. Bread. Slight lemon taste. 
Feel: thin mouth feel. No dryness at all. Very crisp and clean finish.
Overall: ok beer. Just not my taste. Prefer IPAs. But this is ok, just not my style.
First drank: home 8/13/14 poured from a bottle.
Clear, slightly pale golden yellow, lots of bubbles. Smells very fresh, wheat and hops with a big spice character. Bread, a little yeast, some spice. Very crisp and refreshing.
Hazy golden color; Medium body: Aroma of malt, hay/grain, and hops; Flavor of sweet malt, grain, hops, and some citrus; Crisp finish; Good for what it is.

Bottle shared. Pours light hazy golden with a big off white head. Aroma of grain, light pepper, light corn and malt. Flavour is light moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Light to medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Not bad for a fairly dull style.

bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thick creamy white head. Slightly hazy golden pour. refreshing taste
(bottle - 22 oz) Orange pour with a white head. Slightly sweet malts and very light and stale hops in the aroma. Flavor is almost identical. Sweet malts then dry grassy hops. Nothing special.
Bottle shared by Canadians. Pours cloudy yellow gold with white head. Nose/taste of peppercorn, lemon, grass and spicy yeast. Medium body.
Bottle - Honey and wheat. Clear gold with a decent white head. Honey and wheat and a long sweet finish. Very sweet but nice.
Bottle, clear yellow pour, aroma of lemon and pepper, taste, very clean and crisp, a bit of pepper with some slight sweetness. Very crushable.
Light golden color with a moderately sized white head. Aroma and flavor are both of honey, flowers, bananas, and grain. A bit of lingering spice on the finish.

Pours a bright cloudy gold with a small white head that fades away to nothingness shortly after the pour.

Grassy earthy and a little bready smell. Not bad, but not exactly pleasant either.

Light crisp malt hits the palate with a just a little bit of grassiness and a hint of lemon to back it up. A every so slight bitterness leaves the tongue coated.

Mouthfeel is very light and carbonated and I was expecting.

Another solid offering from 3F showing they can hold back and make a great light style as well though its nothing special. Its been a couple years since I first had this and I was pleasantly surprised.

Bomber. Pours a golden color with medium white head, okay retention, decent lacing. Nose is malt and grassy. Mouth is more of same. I get the German-style interest but the style itself is uninspired (especially considering what these guys are famous for making their bones doing) . This is one of the more underwhelming 3Fs beers Ive had, but it isnt their fault that lagers arent exactly exciting beers in the first place. Luckily I didnt drive down to Munster for this one.
22oz bottle ... At the Killens BBQ tasting  pours a mildly hazed gold medium head, light lacing .. . Hay, bench, and dirty straw .. . Light mouth .. . Decent helles.. . . Standing in line for BBQ?

Reviewed 8-26-10

My wife picked this one up for me when she was in Chicago visiting family. 

Ap: It pours a crisp light orange color, with mild cloudiness, and slight head. There is a fair amount of carbonation. 

Ar: Tons of Noble hop smell, but I couldnt really tell it was a FFF beer at all. Their signature hop profile was missing.

T: Very clean lager with tons of German malts and a refreshing hop finish.

P: I like the carbonation on this one - very comforting! Its a very smooth brew in general.

Overall: Not too heavy, sticky, or complex - just a good old-fashioned drinker. Not exactly the type of beer FFF is know for, but Ive never known these guys to faulter, no matter what they do!
I dont know why this bottle looks like it wants to kill me, because this is a nice, light and refreshing quaffer.
Bottle from FFF. Poured light hazy yellow orange with min head. Floral honey sweet aroma. Quite smooth balanced typical lager taste. Tame for FFF.

Bottle. Light gold with fluffy white head. Nose is lager yeast and light citrus. Taste is also citrusy. Crisp palate. Well made lager but not super flavorful. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at the beer Trappe in Lexingto, Kentucky it is a clear golden color with a slight white head. The aroma is floral and the taste is rather bitter with some sourness that lingers on the palate
On draft at The Beer Trappe in Lexington, KY. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Aroma of bananas and peaches. Crisp clean finish. Excellent (for a lager).
Draft at rj grunts. Clear orange pour. No head. Lemon scent. Slight bite for a German beer but great taste. Super refreshing. Like this

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2013 Not a huge fan of lagers, but this is pretty mediocre for Three Floyds. Pours a hollow golden color with a thin, white head. Nose and taste is similar. Nice combo of grain and malt and hints of pear and apple. Crisp and refreshing on a hot day. This beer has potential but fell a little short. Overall, i wouldn?t go out of my way to find it.

Crisp golden coloured body with a thin, one centimetre tall just off-white head and a ton of small bubbles rising from the bottom. Aroma of light malt, alcohol, apple juice, lemons and hints of sour lime. Medium-bodied; Strong apple and pear flavoured malt with a nice light hop note, some slight sour flavours and a good crisp herbal finish. Aftertaste shows a moderate amount of complexity, some smooth fruit flavours and a good malt note with not much alcohol flavours noticeable. Overall, a nice beer - but not stellar in any way. If you peeled this label off and put it in a different bottle, this beer would be rated way lower - its a decent beer, and thats it. Nice to try given its from Three Floyds, but dont go out of your way for this! I sampled this 65 cL bottle purchased from Discount Liqour in Milwaukee, Wisconsin on 05-September-2012 for US$8.49 sampled at home in Washington on 07-July-2013.
22oz bomber pours a clear gold with a white head. Malt aroma. Taste is the same with grain.
Bottle. Pours a clear dark golden color with a moderate white head. This has that funky lager smell to me that I just dont care for. Taste is fairly light and crisp, just not terribly appealing.
Pours gold with a white head and aroma of malt and grains. Taste is of malt, caramel, and grains with a dry, malty finish. Not my favorite style of beer, but for a lager could do worse

Pours a hazy golden yellow pour with no head. Nose is malty and grainy. Taate is grainy, and malty. Even the great Three Floyds cannot turn me into a lager lover. For the style fine, for the taste not by type. Quaff Score 5 / 10 
Rated as an ale lover, not a lager lover!
hazy golden. Small fluffy head. Aroma is sweet/honey, grassy, grain, floral. Light to medium body. Some bitterness, crisp. Grain, fruity, floral hop, honey, earthy malt. Balanced.
bottle, crisp lager. pale straw color, saaz/noble hop aroma, touch of grassiness. very nice for style
Bomber. Light and crisp. Hay, grass and some malt. Went down easy. Good for a style I normally don't like.

Location: 22 oz bottle from jcos, 2/8/13


Aroma: It has a clean lager nose, with plenty of grains and some grassy hops

Appearance: Pours a clear yellow-gold color with a think white head and light lace

Flavor: Tastes clean and malty, a bit sweet, grains/bread, and some grassy/spicy hop bitterness

Palate: The body is light and somewhat crisp, it has average carbonation, and a dryish finish

Overall Impression: 
Thanks to Kramer!  Overall, I thought this was good for the style, but not 3 Floyds good.  Still though, I could easily session the heck out of this beer.  It isnt up there with best, most crisp lagers on the market, but it is still a well above average Helles beer.

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, no bottle dating.  Pours hazy golden straw color with a 1-2 finger fluffy bright white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers.  Spotty lacing clings down the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation.  Aromas of lemon, pear, apple, grass, orange, cracker, bready grain, floral, pepper, and herbal hops.  Damn nice aromas with good strength and balance of hop/malt notes.  Taste of lemon, pear, pepper, orange zest, apple, cracker, bready grain, grass, floral, and herbal spiciness.  Lingering notes of citrus, light fruit, pepper, cracker, bready grain, grass, floral, and herbal spiciness on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice flavor balance with good complexity; very hoppy but still has nice malt balance; with zero cloying flavors present after the finish.  Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth and crisp mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an excellent helles lager!  Great flavor balance with good complexity; extremely smooth and crisp to drink.  A very enjoyable offering as expected.
Its a lager.  Full of lagery lagerness.  Stronger and more drinkable than a normal lager.  Definately the weakest in the 3 floyds rotation.
Great American Beer Festival, 2012. Gold color. Mild hops and malt, but solid palate in a good session style.

Bottle (22 oz). Traded by dresden, thanks Steve! Golden with a foamy white head and good lacing. Aroma is fresh and crisp with noble hops, cereals, slight citrus and spices. Taste is grainy with some malt and spices. Dry finish. Clean. Refreshing and drinkable. Right on style. Very good Helles!

Bottle: &nbsp Pale straw, hazy, large fluffy white head, nice lacing, moderate carbonation. &nbsp Soft straw/hay and general grassy nose. &nbsp Very soft hop presense. &nbsp Smooth soft hay and barnish grassiness on the tongue. &nbsp This is great stuff! &nbsp Never thought I would have such an iconic German beer from the US that was this good! &nbsp Light sweetness, straw, touch of hops. &nbsp Very well balanced. &nbsp This would indeed be one of those great Summer beers to sit back and drink at a ballgame. &nbsp Much better than I expected!
Euro-style Lager. Very solid for style with a crisp finish. Pared well with spicy dinner. Slight hint of malt.
Served at GABF 2012. Clear gold thick head smooth delicious some citrus bitter.
Sampled at GABF on Saturday October 13, first sessionHazy golden color, white head. Sweet, apple scent. Sweet, apple taste. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness.
Very basic beer.  Nice and refreshing, light , balanced, clean, wheat, grain, light hop
draft - pours pale yellow and smells like a pilsener.  yes, refreshing, but very light and almost skunky.

Aroma: Heavy floral hops with hints of malt underneath.
Appearance: Clear gold with thick, white head.
Taste: Light bitterness with faint sweetness. VERY nice and well balanced.
Palate: Medium body, average carbonation, slick texture, crisp, flavorful finish.
Overall: VERY well crafted. A bit watery in the finish, but that could simply be part of the style. Still, Id stock this any day and use it to convert my macrobrew friends to the joys of microbreweries!
Aroma is pale malts and a complex fruit profile, with tropical fruit mixed in.  The flavor is pale malts, fruit/berries, bubble gum sweetness and a dryish/tangy finish.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with a small off white head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is bread and wheat. Medium mouthfeel with a sweet hop with grain and wheat flavor. Sweet finish, a decent helles from Three Floyds.

On tap. Clear golden pour with a slight eggshell head. Nose is sweet, fruity, grassy, with light pine, some lemon zest and a touch of honey. Taste is nice and sweet with some bitterness. Palate is light, refreshing and crisp. Nicely done, understated for once.

From the September 2012 3R6P gathering. +++ Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured a very pale yellow color with a medium sized soapy white head that left decent lacing. The aroma was sour and tangy with notes of tropical fruits, bread, band aid and artificial grape. The flavor was dry and tangy artificial grape, perfume and band aid. Long finish of artificial sugar, perfume and a faint medicinal aftertaste. Light to medium body. Uninspired

22 oz. bottle. Pours pale gold with a medium, off-white head. The aroma is white bread, saaz hops, coriander, grass, and faint lemons. The flavor is mildly bitter, with a nice, light, citrus sweetness. The palate is light to medium, a little sticky, and fairly clean in the finish. Overall, this is a nice, light lager, with a good mouthfeel,

651mL thanks to tastybeer. Long time want of mine! Pours a clear golden, medium white head, soapy retention. Nose is fruitier canned peach, canned pineapple, vanilla bean. Taste is dry, grassy, biscuity, mild paper and cardboard. A bit better than the Calumet Queen, but probably wouldnt be my go to FFF beer. Need to find their house pilsener.

On tap at Alchemy, pours a clear bright golden yellow with a thin bubbly white head, the aroma is crisp with a slight hop touch but mostly grain and hay notes, the flavor has a crisp amount of cereal and bread with a little bit of hop bite in the finish, really straight forward and easy drinking, not bad at all.

Pours like a ordinary brew just with a nicer head, aroma is mostly hay and cereal. Taste is grainy and lots of hay and some grassy notes, a bit of spice and a little hops. An ok brew, Im just not a big fan of this style, or lagers in general

Draft to pint at Dutchs. Looks fine; a transparent gold with thin white lacing. Smells like a slightly sweet and bitter lager (a little doughiness too). Tastes like it smells, only better, with an average mouthfeel. A good example of the style, but not worth what they charge for a bomber ($10).
Clear golden with a foamy white head. Light smelling, a little spice and noble hop. Crisp and clean, dry finish. Really good lager, but pretty tame for FFF. Good beer!

22oz bottle. About time I focked my gorch. Thin bubbly white head. Bubbles on the side of the glass. Head fades to minimal. Clear golden color. 1 or 2 dots of lace. Smooth carbonation. Dry finish. Basic helles sweetness in there, but it also leans towards the side of zesty and bitter. Bready aroma, but also a note of citrus. Some particles in the last pour, little more lace. Nice lightly spicy aftertaste. Light saltiness. Pretty drinkable, and an interesting take on the helles style without going too far out of the box

Bottle from palmer's in columbus, oh. Pours golden and light. This is a really good example of its style--it's not particularly interesting but on a warm summer night, it hits the spot.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22oz bottle. Poured a pale golden color with a medium sized white, foamy white head. Aroma was grassy, with some grainy biscuit notes. Flavor was a bready malt note, with a touch of light citrus. Interesting brew.

Bomber:
Pours slightly hazy yellow gold with a tall, lacy, off-white head.
Scent is malty, sweet grapefruit.
Flavour is malty.....slightly spiced...almost on the edge of acidic...nice tartness.
Not 3F awesome....but still pretty good stuff.

Poured from bottle into a pilsner glass. Pours a medium gold color with a nice head.

nice and balanced with aromas of bananas, grains, noble hops, and some crackers.

Smooth medium body with a very complete feel. Well balanced with good flavors of citrus, grains, and noble hops.

A very good helles lager. Well balanced with good noble hops. Nice and complete on the feel with good depth, but lacking some on flavors.
65cl, as Gorch Fock, no mention of ABV, exclusive American brew, thx to Secret Santa!, complex brew, malty/floral and slightly sweet, balanced, hazy, good head, nice brew, yet expensive!
In pint...bad pour.  Sweet caramel, malt aroma. Caramel, malt, up front....taste disapates quickly.  Clean finish.....nice on a hot day.

Pours a bight clear golden with a white head.  Aroma is much lighter, with bread, honey, and a bit spicy.  Kind of a grainy taste, corn also, a bit grassy as well.  Dry mouthful and quite carbonated.  This one is dull unfortunately.

22 oz bottle pours a clear golden orange with a smaill white head and a little lacing.  Aroma has grass, lemon, and bitter hops.  Taste is bitter/sour, but with a clean finish.  Medium body and not much carbonation. Enjoyable, but not as outrageous as Ive come to expect from FFF.

On tap at the brew pub in a stein. Pours a clear gold with a thin white head and ok lacing. Aroma is grains, light hops, earth. Taste is malty and light. Thin mouthfeel and great representation of the style.

Bottle, poured a slightly hazy golden orange color. Head was non exisitant and lacing was medium. Aromas of bitter hops, dough, pilsner scents. Taste is a bready forward, hoppy helles that finishes a little bitter on the tongue. Pretty refreshing. Another drinkable beer from 3F.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden straw color with a short white head. Malty aroma with grass, sweet grains and some floral notes. Flavor was lightly sweet with bready malts, grass, grains and a hint of lemon with a dry & crisp finish.
Feels crisp, and loaded with cereal grains. Slight skunk flavor, but not as much as I would have thought for its age. So crisp and clean. Almost feels like a slightly heavy Kolsch.
Bottle pours a hazy yellow/gold with a thin white head. Scent is grassy and bready. Taste is same with a lemon note.

22oz bottle.

Pours a slightly hazy golden straw with a small soapy white head that receded to a small collar.

Aroma is light sweet malts, doughy bread and some light fruity pears.  Maybe a hint of hops, grassy for sure.

Taste is more grainy with some corn and toasted grains as well as the sweet bready malts.  Spicy hop bitterness in the finish.

Mouthfeel is light, crisp and clean with strong carbonation.

A very good helles lager, one of the better Ive had, which isnt a whole lot admittedly.  Crisp and highly drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2012 I?m not typically a huge fan of Helles lagers, but I really did enjoy this one. Honey-like floral smell, flavor and sweetness. Beautiful bright. Beautiful straw color and nice mouthfeel. (750ml Bottle/Purchased by Daniel in Madison) 02/2012

Date: January 25, 2012 Mode: Tap Source: Tomlinson Tap Room Description: Not much to look at, but was very good for the style.  Light, grainy, slight carbonation, not my thing to get a huge rating but would be nice in the summer.
Its a traditional German helles lager. Not one of my favorite styles, but this is well-crafted, I suppose. I just think the style is boring.

On tap at 3fs. Nothing mind-blowing here (as far as 3fs standards are), but still quaffable and pleasant. Frothy white and good carbonated retention on the pour, with a medium-light appearing, golden-orange body. The aroma is grainy, with various cereals and multigrain malt coming through. Also, herbal grass and hazy, light caramel. The body is well carbonated, light and fluffy as well. The flavor is distinct mix of herbal grass, mixed grains, and caramel cookie. Overall, a quality beer to finish off our summertime brewpub roadtrip.

Poured from a bomber into a footed pilsner glass. Appearance is clear gold with a thick, rocky head of white foam with loads of bubbles keeping the head inflated. Aroma is fairly light, but i can detect a floral hop presence and a slight bready, biscuity note. Smells sweet. Taste is juicy with a drying herbal note. Finish is quick and the beer leaves a faint grainy aftertaste. Super light and quaffable. It wouldnt be outrageous to down a bomber of this in a short amount of time. Quite refreshing.

Pours, as one would expect, a clear light gold color.  nice white head. Aroma is lightly hopped with a bit of sweetness in there too.  Taste is actually fairly flavorful, but nothing over the top.  As far as the style goes, very well done.

bomber 8/18/11.

golden tinted yellow with a small white head.

aromas of straw, yeast, lemon, spice and pils-y grain.

the flavor is quite similar only with added richness and a vanilla note. there is a lemony tartness on the finish. 

very crisp. food friendly. sessionable. 7/4/7/4/16+

22oz bottle. Pours a clear yellow color with a white head. Aroma is malty, bready, sweet.  A little light on the palate with soft carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, cereal, with a light, spicy hop finish.  A nice choice for a hot summer day. To bad its late October.

Bottle. Small white head has a short life on top of pale amber. Light grain scent. May be splitting lagers but tastes like a Kellerbier. Thick mouthfeel of dried peas. Grainy with a lot of earthy malt. Doesnt sing.

Bottle. Pours pale hazy golden yellow with a big sudsey off white head and fades to a film and lacing. Aroma is sweet grass and citrus with malts and grians. Taste is crisp bready malt and grass with a lemon spice. Palate is thin to medium with a crisp dry finish.
Great example of a Munich helles. Picked this up on a whim and it was exactly what I was looking for.

Bomber from Sahara Mart, Bloomington. So nice to see FFF on the shelf, and what a cool label this is (reminds me of a P. Craig Russell drawing). I think that some of this brewerys better beers are the more sessionable ones, and while I dont think they hit this out of the park the way they do some others, its pretty enjoyable nonetheless. Nice deep golden pour, with a crisp cracklin head to it and vigorous carbonation. Nose is lightly hoppy, with a trace of spice and evident malts. Lively body, slightly spicy palate. Flavors were dry, crisp, and lightly fruity. Satisfying for sure.

A: The beer pours a fairly clear golden straw color with a couple fingers of white head.

S: A nice sweet malt aroma to this on the front end with a large pale malt presence.  Theres a bit of yeast and some grassy and floral hops.  A very mild skunk followed by some fruity esters.

T: Like the aroma, sweet malt up front with a definite corn note.  The flavor is primarily of pale malt with some sweet apple esters.  Some light floral hop notes and a touch of yeast and bitterness.

M: Light in body with medium carbonation.

O: Thought this was a pretty solid lager.  And you dont often find a well made Helles from a US brewery.

Pours a hazy pale yellow with a thick, foamy white head...nice lacing.  Aroma of hay with some grassiness.  Flavor follows suit...very malty...some subtle earthy hop notes.  Mouthfeel is very creamy and lively and the dry finish is crisp and clean.  Nice representation of the style!
Bomber pours a cloudy golden with a medium white head. Aroma of sweet grains, yeast, light fruits, and malt. Taste of cereal maltiness, yeast, and hay. Nice, light, crisp, and refreshing.

Drank a 22 oz bottle of this from a plastic cup while walking to the Titans Stadium this Sunday. We won 26-13. Im a pretty big 3 Floyds fan. A fan boy if you will. While this is certainly an above average lager it is not an exceptional beer. Good malt balance. Not heavy handed. Little spice. The hops are subservient here though. Maybe its the noble hops. Very light.

22oz. Bottle: Got in trade from QueenHolly; THANKS Rebekah! Aroma of vegetables, herbs, noble hops, corn, and grain.  Poured yellow/gold in color with a small, loose, white head that disappeared, except for around the edges.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of tiny particles throughout.  Flavor is lightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of lager yeast, noble hops, vegetables, and grains.  Light to slightly medium body.  Tingly, then dry texture.  Average to slightly lively carbonation.  Lightly sweet, lightly bitter, vegetable, lager yeast, grain finish is lightly dry.

Great balanced fruity and yeasty flavor without being too sweet or astringent. The best Three Floyds beer Ive had (I dont like gumball head or many of their exceptionally hoppy beers). Nice amount of bitterness too. I enjoyed this so much I had another one.

Pours a light golden yellow with little to no head, which dissipates rapidly. Floral, grassy aroma and flavor, with a nice clean finish to it. Not particularly complex, but not really my style of beer, either.

Bottle. Sweet malt, citrus, and spice aroma. Straw colored with a fluffy white head. Really nice malt flavor with a hint of hops and spice. Light carbonation. Very enjoyable in the current 100 degree weather.

Enjoyed on tap at Owen and Engine in Chicago, IL while waiting to get my passenger side window replaced after my car got broken into.  Damn hooligans!  Appearance a slightly cloudy gold with a very rich white head, very pronounced. Aroma very light and english definite biscuit malt presence with light grassy touch. Taste is definite session ale, nice yeast presence, lemongrass is noticeable, goes down almost too smooth. Very good, easy drinker after a long aggravating day.

On tap at Cerulean Garden in Winona Lake, IN.  Pours hazy gold with a fluffy cloud-like head.  Aroma is light malt, hay, spicy hops, and spicy yeast.  Flavor is spicy light malt with some honey-like sweetness a spicy hop finish with some light bitterness.  A nice summer refresher.
Light and spiced with a lot of carbonation. Refreshing good and not what I was epecting them to bring to GABF
22 ounce bomber, pours a clear yellow with huge white head.  Aromas of grass, and straw.  Has a crisp bready, straw, flavor with some hops, and a hint of caramel.
Hazy yellow with a white head.  Grassy aroma.  Taste is honeyish malt with a sour not a medium noble hops.
Malty and grain on the nose.  My wife said "it smells like German Fest".  Medium body with a clean finish.  Great beer to mow the grass to.
Bomber, pours clean straw w/ super effervescent foamy head, aroma is nutty Continental malt, super rich malt flavor, incredible depth for the simplicity of the malt profile, delicious
Pours straw yellow with nice malt notes.  Traditional hops on the mouthfeel show a crisp refreshing finish.

Pours a slightly hazy straw color with a 1 finger head and moderate head retention.  Aroma is woody, spicy noble hops with sweet clean grain and caramel.  Taste is bread, caramel, noble hops, and overall very clean.  Body is medium-full with average carbonation and a dry finish.  Overall, a great straightforward lager from the worlds premier ale brewery!
If you like lagers, you should love this. Crisp, clean and it has a awesome dry finish. Flavorful. Delicious. Wish this was inside alll those red cans with eagle on them.

On tap at the Hop Leaf in Chicago.  Pours a clear orange with a white head.  Aroma of pale malts and bready malt.  Flavor is bready with sweet malt and some light fruits.  Tasty and uber drinkable.
7/4/7/4/14 [3.6/5]

Yellow-orange pour with a white head. Light aroma of citrus and yeast. Flavor is fairly simple with a nice balance of malts and hops. A good citrus flavor with a sweet finish. Not bitter at all. Very solid but there are stronger contenders at Three Floyds.

Lightly hazy straw color pour. 22 oz bottle. Nice light grain and light spice/grass aroma. Yum. The flavor is far better than I expected. Refreshing grain with a very light malt sweetness. Negligible hop presence but enough to dry the finish out just a bit. The body is a bit more full than is like but still ok. A fine beverage.
Bottle. Clear yellow pour with white head. Aroma of light cereal, grass. Taste is light, crisp cereal, slightly sweet, a touch of honey. Palate is light, refreshing and well carbed. Pretty good beer.

old notes got a bottle of this last summer on our trip to three floyds.  from a 22oz bomber Pour murky golden color with a nice off white head. smell is of grassy straw and yeast. Taste is of the grass and yeast with some spicy.  This is exactly what it says it is a helles. not bad but not my favorite.

Aroma is light grains, faint hops, pretty subtle, faint DMS.  Pours a slightly hazy light golden, lots of fizzy white head but poor retention and no lacing.  Light grains, a touch of spicy hops, malty, clean flavor.  Light body, medium-high carbonation, feels a bit thin.
Hazy yellow color with a white head. Aroma of bready malts and some spices. Taste is light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel.

From the Jug at the GABF, Colorado Convention Center Denver 18/09/2010 (As Gorch Foch Helles)
Hoppy aroma. Golden coloured smooth on the palate and fruity banana flavour with a hint of bitterness in a malt finish.

I hated heir oktoberfest as it wasnt at all what I associate the style with, this however is a great example of the Muenchener Helles style. It has a bready malt presence balance by spicy/hebal/grassy hops. It isnt over the top hoppy like all the other FFF beers, FFF held back and created an actual true-to-style beer here.
This is a nice refreshing beer. Light bodied with good carbonation. A nice style of brew. Reminds me of FFF interpretation of a hefewizen. Good beer to give a try.

Aroma: hay, wit beer like aroma spice included, straw, bready. Pour slightly hazy golden orange absurd amount of head constant high volume of carb traveling up from bottom of glass. Taste spicy, grassy, bready, German malt. Medium body very lively carb. A decent brew nothing special.
I am not very familiar with this style. It is a very subtle clean smooth pale ale. Nothing offensive or outstanding. Very easy drinking.

Sent by Bauermj, pours a clean straw yellow with one finger of creamy off white head. Nose is sweet and bready with some DMS. A bit grassy. Flavor is weird, bready with some creamed corn. A mild sweetness and some hay. Crisp palate.

Bottle, shared by Ethan.  Pours a urine-tinted golden with no head, yet adequate carbonation. Some light malts, light fruit, pretty bland.  Flavor is the same, tastes like a not fresh helles.  This might have been good, last spring.  Oh well.

Pours a crystal clear light golden color with a smallish white head that leaves quickly. Aroma is mild malts some spicy and floral hops and a little diacetyl in there too. Taste is sweet and bready malts. Body is medium with a sharp carbonation tickle on the tongue. Not a bad brew, not my favorite as I think its a bit sweet.
Yep its from 3Floyds and I like it. Seems to be a trend. Little spicy and would love to have a thin crust pizza with it.
Clean, pure tasting.   Great "lawnmower" beer, but right now, the lawn is under about six inches of snow.  Nice brew, but there are others that taste like this for a bit cheaper.

Traded bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden-amber color with a small, bubbly, white head. Big lager aroma that is also a little sweet from citrus noted. Really great flavor. Smooth and a little spice with some mellow caramel notes. Well done.

22 0z poured into a pint glass.  This beer smells of banana, fruit, and spice.  The appearance is a light golden color with a foamy white head that dissipates.  The taste is traditional lager with medium bitterness, and spicy hops coming through.  Not a huge lager fan, but this one is nice.  You can very much taste the czech influence probably from the Noble pilz hops.  Very good for a style I am not too fond of
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a big white head. Flavor is crisp, herbal, fruity, mildly sulfuric, with a light and spicy hop profile. Very refreshing.

Pours yellow with a small fading white head. Herbal hops, sweet cereal malts, slightly and pleasantly sulfur like.  Taste as a nice floral and slightly spicy hop profile with clean malt in the back end finishing dry and as crisp as described.  Lively carbonation keeps the palate dancing.  Seems good but not my style.

Thanks to ScottyP for splitting this with me. Hazy gold, frothy white head. Aroma of sugar, malt, fruit, mild hop. Taste is malty with that cane sugar kind of body and texture. Not bad, just not a style I like a whole lot. Sweet label.

Pours a moderately dark yellow with a nice white head. Smell is doughy, sweet malt with traces of hops. Fairly simple but well executed. Taste is quite as clean. Mouthfeel is light to medium with good carbonation and nice body. Good drinkability but not my favorte Three Floyds beer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-24-2010

Pours a slightly hazy golden with thick, white bubbly head.  Aroma is bready, some spice, hint of malts and hops.  Similar taste, somewhat dry finish.  Light and crisp.  Not my favorite style, but I could drink this all day over any domestic lager.
22oz bottle in an English pint.  Aroma of light malts and a slight hoppiness.  Better than most beers this style, but still a German style beer.

Bottle from stfun. Thanks my friend! Not familiar with this style at all but here we go.... Pours a yellow color, big head. Weak aroma of some crisp bread maltiness. Taste is the same..... clean crisp noble hops... light bread maltiness. Spicey... A little fruity... Easy to drink. Light body but not watery. Good job 3F... Overall: Probably  really nice when its super fresh in the summer, but an enjoyable brew none the less.  Thanks josh for the great box!

Pours a light hazy golden color with a thin white head.  The aroma is very mild providing soft citrus and sweet caramel malts.  An interesting smokey flavor initially with a light bitterness.  Kind of an oily mouthfeel.
poured cloudy golden yellow/orange with a simple head but very nice lacing on the glass- not much for aroma - not very bitter - hint of citrus - nice drinkable brew but nothing special-
Didnt know much of anything for me.  I think I probably just dont like the style, but I think German beers are just a little flat and plain to me.  Give a spaten or else Ill just stick to ale.

I like all Three Floyds beer, this one probably isnt for me because of the style.  A nice lighter lager, not as good as the Marzen. If Im near Three Floyds beer, this isnt what Im going for, as they are rare in DC.

22 oz. bottle from West Lakeview Liquors.  Pours a clear golden color with a big eggshell white head.  Aroma of grassy hops, straw, vanilla, sweet pale malts, cereal, and light herbs.  The flavor largely follows suit, leaning heavily on the malts for a Dortmunder.  Light-medium bodied, with slightly higher than average carbonation and a malty mouthfeel.  Finishes with a little grainy malt and dryness.  Awesome take on a Dortmunder; probably not exactly to traditional style, but excellent nonetheless.

aroma- grassy sweet malt, some yeast, slight lemon.  pours cloudy gold.  palate is carbonated and refreshing as is expected, with a light-medium body.  taste is sugary malt and yeast, lemon, with a bitter dry finish.  very nice!

Pours a light apricot color with minimal white head. Aroma is dry and hoppy. Taste is hops, some berry and somethign which I couldnt place but narrowed down to either licorice, bubblegum, or some manner of root. Clean mouth feel. Overall, I wasnt thrilled with this beer. In many ways, it reminded me of an industrial light beer, though certainly much better. Wont get it again but glad I tried it.
Pours heavy with a thin head.  Aromas of sweet berry and wheat.  Cloudy pale golden in color.  Taste familiar, with smooth sweet palate.  I would buy this again if I could get it locally
Sampled at GABF on 9-18-2010.  Clear light gold with a nice white head.  Aroma of malt, citrus and some hops.  Flavor somewhat sweet, with some citrus tartness.  Light and refreshing.

Tasted on draft at Local Option.  Pours a clear bright yellow with an average white head that leaves some lace on the collar.  The nose is light malt with some fruitiness and citrus hops.  The flavor is fairly light with malt with the addition of some citrus and white peppercorn.  The body is light with average carbonation and a medium citrus and white peppercorn finish.

Pours a clear lemon copper with a thick layer, yet a very frothy light
white head. Aroma is earthy grass, citrus (lemon), and a bitter
caramel. Flavor is is crisp citrus mixed with sweet bread flavor
(definite bitter notes offset by a bready sweetness). Body is light
with a lot of carbonation.

bread, hay, herbs, dough, pale, sparkling, white foam, medium sweetness, light body, thin feel, fizzy, long finish, 

A great lager.  I was expecting a little more color and a little more bitternesss.  However this turned out to be a wonderful lager.  Very carbonated, with a soft malt sweetness that sticks on the pallete.  No noticeable hop flavors or aroma, but well balanced for the beer.  Friend brought me a 22 when he went to the midwest, but if it was on my shelves around here, i would reach for it when i wanted a simple, clean, effervescent lager.
Pours clear golden with a thin white head and a nondescript aroma. There is a decent pale malt flavor with a pilsner effect and sufficient hop bitterness for balance.

A well carbonated golden beer that has a nice white head that never goes away.  That foam adds pleasantly to the creamy feel.  Aroma and flavor are pretty much identical.  Light fruit notes, light malt, soft honey.  I love the low ABV here.  This is a pleasant beer but not a great one.  For the style, though, it is pretty damned good.

Bomber into pint glass.  This one was pricey, so lets hope its good.  Pours a boring yellow color, but I will give it credit for the big creamy inviting white head.  Nice lace to boot.  The aroma is very soft and creamy--pale malt, vanilla, and grassy hops.  The flavor is quite pleasant also.  Sweet malt, almost fruity upfront, followed by a nice grassy resinous hop bitterness.  Medium dry finish.  No hint of alcohol.  Light body with low carbonation, which I enjoy.  Overall: damn solid session beer, if it were only reasonably priced.

Draft at FFF.  Served in an imperial pint glass.  Orange-tan with a steady white head.  A really smooth, creamy lager, right on.  Doughy and yeasty.  Mild orange-cream flavors at times.  True to style, perfectly executed.  Brewhouse fresh aroma.  Nice.

On Draft:  Pours a light clear golden color, with a modest white head. Smell and flavor of Citrus and Noble Hops with a touch of spice. This brew is light and refreshing, as you would expect from a decent helles. Another quality FFF brew.

Bottle from West Lakeview Liquors.  Yellowish-gold color, lively carbonation, pours with a thick white head.  Good head retention provides some nice sticky lacing.  Corn and grassy notes in the aroma, some bread too, as well as the noble hops.  Flavor is sweet and malty showing quite a bit of corn.  Some bready and biscuity qualities with lots of grassy and hay notes along the way.  Hops in the finish to dry it out a little.  I do enjoy a good lager on a warm day but this one just didnt do it for me.  Not as crisp and refreshing as expected.  It passes as a decent session but nothing more than that and if available locally (yeah, I wish) Id have a hard time justifying the price of this one for a revisit.

had a sample at FFF brewpub.  Pours golden and clear.  Crisp with a nice hop presence.  My palate was smoked, due to previous hop bombs.  however, light grain and pils noted.  Not a lager-kindve-guy, but would chose this over most others.

Bottle. Pours light gold with slight haze and thin head.  Aroma is of sweet malt and bread with a touch of hops.  Light body with crisp, sweet, spicy, malt and yeast flavor with some clean bitterness on the finish.  A nice lager with some character.
Yellow with a fizzy white head. Sweet malty aroma and taste with mild citrus and vanilla notes.
Lager nose, lager-gold appearance.  Too light for me, though not to bad for a lager.
golden, slightly hazy with a thin head.  very crisp pale lager, flavorful with the noble hops popping through.  well balanced...not a big lager drinker, but i could throw back a few of these.

Unfiltered, slightly hazy helles with thin white head.  Pale lager malts, light noble hops in the nose.  Also a touch of skunk, which is nice in small quantities.  Full of carbonation.  A bit on the sweet side.  Decent body, but lacking the "x-factor" depth of body I get spoiled with with all the great lager breweries in Wisconsin.  Clean finish, slightly dry and mild bitterness.  Good but not great.

Bottle. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy aroma with some grassy hints. Sweetish malty grainy flavor with hoppy hints. Has a sweetish malty grainy finish with some bitterness in the aftertaste.

This beer pour yellow with a nice white head.  The aroma is sweet.  The taste is light, crisp, and might just hit the spot on a warm German afternoon at the beer garden.  The flavor is light grains, pils malt, grass, spice, and yeast.  Not really my style but good for what it is.

Served to an Imp. pint glass at the brewpub, with a golden color, modest, white head foam, and draping sheets of lacing. The aroma was light  toastiness, and light notes of grain, pils malt, yeast, and spice. The flavor added a good balance of malts and hop bitterness, with medium- body, and lively carbonation. A crisp, sessionable Helles.

Imperial pint on tap from FFF brewpub. Presented as a medium-to-light gold with almost no head. Light pils aroma. Very light flavor with a foamy texture. Its great. Hard to tell the exact flavor after that double IPA, but I know its good. My pregnant wife would drink it all night long. Oh sorry, she said "all day long."

Not bad, but nothing special which is odd for 3 Floyds. Poured with a smallish, cream colored, short lived head and no lace. Color is an almost clear amber. Aroma is malt, cereal, fresh beer, fresh cut grass. Color is malt, grain, slighlty bitter, more sweet. Body is a touch on the  heavy side, ok carbonation. Finish is like flavor. Wouldnt pay this much money again for a  beer like this.

Found a bottle of this out in Hudson, WI over the weekend. Pours a nice deep golden yellow with a nice white head. Smells of sweetness with slight fruit notes. Taste is very smooth, slight sweet with a subtle bitterness at the end. Very solid overall. Also come with a sweet label!

(Old BA rate - bottle)
Poured with a thinner white head that dissipated quickly; yellow-orange hue that was mostly clear. Sweet malts; yeat; candy; bready; and no hop presence. Breadiness and sweetness dominate; but indicative of the Maibock style. good dryness at the end. Medium; clings a bit to the palate but not badly. OK; interesting in so far as that its better than some of the German counterparts that Ive had. Overall, not the best example (or maybe I just dont care for the sweeter takes), but OK drinking.
Bottle. Pale yellow color with tons of carbonation. Flavor is pale malts, slightly toasty, notes of juicy fruit in here as well. Finish is dry and clean. Light bodied and smooth, a fine session beer.

Boring golden yellow with quick fading head and little to no lacing.  Aroma is light herbal hops and sweet yellow cake.  Taste is similar, crisp and sweet on the front end and slightly too thick on the back end, but otherwise nice full mouthfeel.  A pretty good beer, and one Id drink loads of on draft.  One day!

22 ounce bottle.  Served in a pilsner glass, the beer pours a somewhat cloudy gold color with a couple inch frothy white head.  Head retention is good, lacing is decent.  Aroma is mostly bready malt and floral hops, but I also pick up a little bit of a citrusy aroma.  Taste is similar to the aroma, but theres the addition of some spicy hops.  Mouthfeel/body is light, its crisp, refreshing, and is well carbonated.  The soft carbonation helps make this an easy brew to drink.  It would be pretty nice to drink on a hot day.  I think this is a decent overall brew, I liked it.
bomber shared DLD-yellow orange pour-white head-aroma and taste of dough, bread, -super smooth finish

lucent gold, thin white head, high co2.

aroma: pilsner funk, sweet corn (more likely dms than adjunct), sulfer.

taste:
T1= smooth, co2, bready malt.
T2= bready pale malt, fruity esters, hint of sweet corn.
T3= pretty clean, a bit of sticky sweet corn.

starts of like a standard american lager, but gets more helles as it goes. easy-drinking sessional, but not very good.

Bottle as my contribution to Dogbricks Portland beer tasting. Not a Portland beer, but something rare I wanted to share. Pours clear gold with a thin white head. Creamy malt aroma with noble hops and lager yeast. Flavor is also creamy malt and noble hops with a sweet finish. About what youd expect from this style.

Aroma is very unique.  Sweet malts, bread, dough and a bit of yeast.  Notes of some spices, maybe ginger.  Very different.  Mouthfeel is a little watered down.  Finishes a little dry, not leaving much of an aftertaste.

[2753-20100207] 1pt6floz bottle. Mild mushroom chocolate olive aroma. Hazy, medium orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Lightly fruity grains flavour. Medium body. Fairly generic, surprisingly.
(From brewery; w/ jerc, others)

Sample at the "Portland? Psh More Like Beerland" tasting on 03/10/10. Thanks to JaBier for sharing a bottle. The beer pours a clear yellow color with a medium white head that recedes steadily. Rings of lacing on the glass. Mild hops aroma with touches of fruit and spice. Light to medium clean body with flavors of floral hops, herbs and malt. The finish is lightly hoppy with a grainy malt aftertaste. Above average overall.
Fairly straightforward for a 3F brew.  Grassy hops and a clean, fresh grain malt character.  A bit one dimensional but solid.

Bottle.  Clear pale orange pour, little carbonation and sweet malt aroma.  Flavor is initially a little hay, sugar sweetness and a little dry hops on the finish.  Im not much of a lager drinker, but this is decent.

Jons bottle. A very good lager, so unfortunately not the best rating range. Cloudy yellow with a big white bubbly head. Fresh aroma. Very fresh tasting. Some lace lines. This starts with a slight, but cumulative building bitterness, that leaves orange. Munich malts, saaz hops. Niceley carbonated. Points on balance.

Pours a slightly hazy straw color.  Large bubble head that quickly went away.  Aroma is sweet, grainy and a hint of noble hops.  The taste is light and crisp.  And just the right amount of metallic twang from the hops.  Very true to the style and quite drinkable.

Pretty nice beer. Again on tap at Dexters. Not normally my style but impressive none the less. Bright golden, slightly cloudy. Big white froth. Initial grain, corn and malt on the nose. Flavours are slightly fruity, noticebly bitter but balanced and creamy to the finish. Very filling and flavourful.

2010-02-08.  Hazy orange body with a modest white head and lace. 3+ Interesting aroma, tropical fruit like character, mild alcohol, muted pale malts. 7+ Flavour is similar, tropical fruit, light alcohol, pale malt base, light bitterness. Smooth average plus bodied palate. Not particularly Helles like, but I enjoyed it. Bottle is approximately four months old so perhaps that has something to do with it? Bottle from either the brewery or Liquor Stop, I dont recall which.

Bottle from Chill Zone in Beaver Dam, Aroma was little funky as they say. Clear gold body with white head. Heavy brew to drink not very smooth on the palate. A starchy honey and spicey lemon mix in the flavor. Odd brew but glad I got the chance to try it.

22 oz. bottle via trade with StFun - Pours a hazy light golden color with a 1/3 finger thick white head.  Very light spotty lacing.  Aroma is grain and light esters.  Flavor is light grain malt, light esters, and a touch of oranges.  Finish has a hint of tartness to it.  Light to medium body.  A nice, easy drinking beer.  Thanks Josh.

9th October 2008. Clear gold beer. Dry palate. Sweetish malt with a distinct banana tone. Bodering on wheat beerish, another competant German brew from this US brewhouse whom does far better when following an original path!

(Sample Date: 7/18/2009   Source:Other)   Courtesy of Allstar. Grainy with a lightly fruity floral nose. Clear light golden with small white head. Light graininess with a medium finish that has light residual bitterness.
Clear yellow pour with almost no head.  Lots of carbonation.  Grainy cereal malt aroma.  Similar taste.  Bitter with a touch of hops.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy golden body with an off white head.  Grainy herbal grassiness, light floral hop tones, some hints of apple and hay.  A bit grain y and dull with a light body.
apples, some citrus (orange), slightly sweet maltiness, a touch of skunkiness, but not in a bad way, not much hoppiness. Super good. Very light, clean and easy to drink done perfectly

Binnys $9.99 22oz bomber 11/09. Light crisp aroma of peaches. Color is golden, slightly hazy. Minimal to no head, light carbonation. Light sweetness, light sourness, little bitterness. Medium body, nice dry finish. I would buy once a year.

Light golden in colour with a thin white head, light lacing.
Aroma is lightly sweet, some grassy and herbal hops, apples, grains and some vegetables.
Flavour is grainy, some pale malts, grassy and floral, light sweetness.
Lightly sweet mouthfeel, medium/light body, moderate carbonation.
Finishes lightly sweet, floral with a finishes bitterness. 
Not my favourite but I much prefer the more extreme beers that Three Floyds make. 
330ml bottle from Sahara Mart in Bloomington, Indiana.
Opened on March 9, 2009.

Sample at GABF 2009. Pours a light golden yellow color with thin white head. Aroma is light and floral with notes of grass, wheat, yeast, bread, honey, hints of banana and spice. Flavor is about the same. Light to medium body with a crisp finish.
Pour is a straw. Nose is some bubblegum but mostly vegetables and corn. Feel is light and delicate.

Thanks Korb for the B-Day bottle from Chicago!  Pours a slightly-hazed, golden straw into the glass, with a thin soapy ring that leaves light window-wash lace.  The nose is of bubblegum and wheatgrass.  Flavors of multiple kitchen spices, some bread, with wheat and grains touching the mid-palate.  The finish closes with a nice grassy hop... very light, and a nice close to an easy quaff.  Quite tasty and well-balanced for a helles.... robust carbonation and lightly-textured for a smooth pull.  Decent!
nice crisp lager, straw color with some head nose is malty grassy some hops but not overpowering. hops in flavor and some biscuity malt grain. overall nice helles

Bottle from Sams W&S. Pours a hazy darker gold (peach) with a slight, creamy white head. Light malt aroma with noble hop acompaniment. Hints at light stone fruit. Medium plus body with creamy carbonation. Flavor is lightly bready, balanced with light spicey hop, and seems lightly fruity. Its balanced and quite tasty. Bet it would be tough to find a tastier beer in the style.

Thanks Stfun! Pours a gold color with a small head.  Malty aroma with a hint of light hops.  Flavor is light and very crisp.  Great with food and really, really sessionable.  Hops and malt are in harmony in this one.  MMM.

9/28/09 notes:  poured at 2009 GABF Thursday.  Pours gold, with average lacing, color and head.  Flavor is mild, with pale malt and a soft floral quality.  Otherwise not too much going on here, which is both good and bad.  I just couldnt get into Gorsch, perhaps a small pour just doesnt do a beer designed to be sessioned in large quantity justice.

aroma is of lightly sweetened barley malt.  appearance is nearly translucent yellow. flavor is of a forefront bitterness that is quite subtle. it fades then returns following lightly chewy, sweet malt. perfect balance is struck in a beer that hits you like a feather and is easy to miss.
Poured from a 22oz bottle into a pint glass.  This has a hazy yellow color with a thin white head.  It has a crisp refreshing taste with earthy notes. A good session for the style.
Light golden yellow pour with white head. Aroma of malt and slightly toated bisquits.Crisp tasting lager- toasted malt, slightly sweet, nice hop balance with malts. Nice aftertaste, good lager.

22oz bottle, slight hazy honey gold hue, with a thick white head, sweet toastey malt, bready dough nose, with some crunchy cereal accents, with a wet hay note, and faint citrusy floral hop aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a sweet honeyed crystal, pale, toasty malt, grainy raw breadiness character, with some crunched cerealm buttery flavors, with a hint of flowery hop grassiness, leading towards a malty, honeyish finish.

Bottle. Poured a pale yellow with a bit of haze and a thin white head. Aroma was full of malts and yeast, a bit musty with a touch of honey. Taste was full of yeast and malts as well with a hint of hops. Flavor was a bit underwhelming, but at the same time that made it very drinkable.
Bottle courtesy of Allstar at Immys Backyard Throwdown. Pours clear golden in color with white head. Aroma honey, malt and hops. Taste malty lemon and honey wtih dry finish.

Brewed in the USA... Courtesy of Woody, thanks again !!!  Pours a hazy yellow color with a thin white head and small carbonation. Aroma of bananas, yeast, malts and hops. Taste is much of the same with the addition of toast and grass. Mouthfeel is medium in body with a dry malty finish. Very easy to drink on a hot summer day !!!!

Bomber via trade (thanks to dug on BA).  Pours a brilliant slightly hazy golden color with a small white head that leaves a ring around the edge of the glass.  Aroma is sweet with malt, grain, and grassy hops.  Flavor is sweet pale malt, grain, honey, lemon, floral and grassy hops.  Palate light and refreshing with medium carbonation and a long finish for a helles.  Great for the style and pretty solid overall.
Cloudy golden pour with a thin white head. Aroma of malt and hops. Flavor of pale malt and mild hops over a light, creamy body. Its crisp, clean, but uninspired.

Bottle. Poured a clear light orange color. The head was two fingers high, off white, and dissipated relatively quickly. Smelled appropriately of pale malts and subdued noble hops. Light bodied and delicately sweet with the flavors following the aromas fairly closely. Decent little beer.

Tap at Binnys (South Loop Location): Slightly hazy light golden pour with a sparce white film of head. Doughy bready pale Munich malt aroma with a mild lagered fruity note yet it remains fairly clean. Nice chewy body for a small beer/ABV. Creamy, doughy Munich malts mesh with a malty spiciness as well and a mild noble bittern note in the finish. Simple, but well done German-style lager

09 Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a teeny tiny white head. Barely any aroma, which is weird for 3F. Especially since there are none of the typical C hops in this. Its a true to style Helles. Flavor is nice and malty but you can still pick out the noble hop flavor even though I couldnt pick it up in the aroma. Not bad, just no aroma, and way too hazy.

22oz bottle. Pours a hazy, bright golden body with a dense, finger-width, pure white head that dissipates slowly and coats the glass with lots of sticky lacing. Aroma isnt what I was expecting from FFF, but very nice for the style. I was expecting an in your face, over-hopped lager, but instead got a nicely balanced, fresh and vibrant aroma. Light floral lemony citrus, apple bread, fresh grains, and honey. A very light tartness mixes well with a nice, pale maltiness. Flavor is similar. Semi-sweet pale malts with a light bread balance well with a citrusy, floral, light bitterness. Some honey, more fresh grains, and a light grassy finish. Semi-dry and lightly bittered in the aftertaste that lasts for a moderate amount of time. Body is medium, smooth, and has just the right amount of crispness. Overall, not what I was expecting, but solid all around. A nice refreshing chance of pace from FFFs usual.

8 13 09
Pours very promising with a thick foamy head, but all I can think is that someone poured 3 oz of H2O in my Dortmunder Gold.

Bottle courtesy of allstar on 07/18/2009. Clear golden body with a medium frothy off-white head. Sweet floral and honey aroma. Sweet floral, light honey, and pilsener malt flavor. Medium light body with moderate carbonation.
Had on tap at Firkin in Libertyville. Very traditional. Not huge in flavor, but extremely clean and easy to drink.

Courtesy of HOPSHUNTER. Pours copper with thin white head. The aroma is sweet malts and grains to go along with a touch of biscuit. The taste has carbonation enhanced malts and grains to start creating a bit of tingle on the tongue. It gets a bit sweeter midway with a thin layer of caramel. Into the finish it seems to get more and more like sweet/tart candy white sugar dipping stick. Hmm.
pretty tame shit for FFF. decant tasting, but i will take a hofbrau over this anyday!!

Bottle courtesy of Allstar at Immys Backyard Throwdown. Golden bodied with a short white head. Aroma is honey, biscuit malts, light lemon, sweet malts, and grassy hops. Ends with more grassy hops, lemon, biscuit notes, and honey sweetness. Excellent and a nice change of pace from the big beers of the day.

22 oz. bottle courtesy of Allstar at Immys Backyard Throwdown.  Light, gold pour with a thin white head.  This is very much a pale lager and therefore I cant get but so excited about it.  Its light and its pleasant enough.  Overall I dont mind something like this but I would never choose this beer because its not my style.  It is what it is and if you like a good helles you will not be disappointed.

On tap at FFF, it poured a light red with a small head. Had a sweet banana bread taste to it. Very good beer and one I will drink again.

Thanks to hopshunter for the share.  Pours red-yellow with a white head.  Nose is malt, corn, lager, and some banana bread.  Flavor is bread, biscuit, banana, sweetness, and some mild bitterness.  A bit thick for a helles, but enjoyable.
bottle thanks to markus.  Pours murky gold, minimal head.  Aroma of yeasts and malts.  German yeasts really come through in the flavor.  Smooth and thinnish on the palate.  Good german style brew.

Bottle courtesy of cexshun.  Poured a light, hazy straw color with a thin white head.  Nose is pale malt with herbal hops, some fruit (apple) is also present and touches of bread.  Mouthfeel is somewhat thin and watery with lively carbonation.  Flavor is mildly sweet with notes of grass, grain, corn and other vegetal tones.  Mildly sweet grassy finish.  Strange Helles, normal for 3 Floyds.

22 oz. bottle shared by Tmoney99.  Pours a slightly hazy dark golden color with a medium sized disappearing white head. The aroma is orange infused wheat bread slightly toasted with a slight splash of honey.  The flavor was more wheat bread, orange citrus, slightly sweet and on the dry side with light bitterness.  Very drinkable on a warmer day I would imagine.  Medium bodied and smooth.

Appearance: Pours a lightly hazed, orange-gold body with a medium-sized, white head.

Smell: Lightly toasted malts, some hearty pils malt, and sweetish whiffs of honey and fruit.

Taste: Faintly toasted and pilsner malts with just a touch of sweet honey and slight grainy dough taste. Some apple and golden raisin fruitiness. Light, spicy Noble hop flavor and imparted bitterness. Smooth, drying finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-low carbonation.

Drinkability: A pleasant, surprisingly authentic helles. Pass the knockwurst and hot German potato salad, please!

Very much a eurolager, but not so much a helles. Poured a darkish gold, modest head. Aroma has hops that are haylike and grassy, with a touch of sulfure. Flavor has more grassy hop, sulfur, plus a touch of caramel and butterscotch/diacetyl. Moderately syrupy. As I said, a real eurolager.
Small white head atop lightly hazed apple juice body. Aroma is medium sweet, grassy, some apple, bread. Taste is medium sweet, bread, some apple, light grass, grain. Clean light body.

My third batch of three floyds from good people bringing it all the way to NC.  pours a clear yellow beer with absolutly no head.  Aroma is malt, flavor is malt weak, earthy light hop.  Great session beer but this has nothing to do with Dark Lord.  It fits the syle well, but is not  a extraordinary beer.

3/26/2009:  Gorch Fock is a really good representation of a German Style Helles Lager (hence the name).  It is smooth, easy to drink, and crisp.  Easily sessionable, flavorful, and just slightly dry paired with a slightly sweet, candyish syrupy citrus quality.  Quite European in nature.  I like this for the style.  

22 fl. oz. bottle shared by Tmoney99.  Thanks!  Rating #166 for this beer.

Hazy, light straw colored with a small pure white head.  Aroma is herbal and somewhat mineral, along with a sweet breadiness, some melon, and a touch of mustiness.  Grainy, bready flavor with a touch of honey is accompanied by a slight acidity and a very crisp hoppiness.  Wow, I really thought this would be a over the top take on the style, but this is actually a pretty authentic take.  This would make a fine session brew, I would imagine a cask version would be beautiful.

Bottle from KJeg Liquor. 

Poured golden color with medium head that diminished quickly with a minimal lacing. Pleasent hop sweet aroma.Medium sweet flavor and medium sweet finished with a good balance of bitter and malt. 

Very drinkable.

decaturstevos Febmergency Tasting.  Sample from a bottle thanks to Butters.  Light orange with a thin white head.  Spicy and lightly fruity aroma.  Malty sweet body with some graininess and spicy malt finish.

The aroma is typical for the style with corn like malt and grassy malt. The appearance is golden with a large head. The flavor is like the aroma. The palate is average for the style. Overall this is pretty typical of the style.
very below average. the malts and hops are subpar. the palate is weak and also very fizzy

Deep gold with slight hint of red. Light corn and a hint of pepper on the nose. Semi sweet smooth malt, light pepper, spice, and corn. Good carbonation from a medium bodied beer. Pretty damn solid beer.

Clear dark yellow with a thin white head.
Sweet malt aroma, little hops as it should be.
Smooth and well balanced.
Nice to see Three Floyds do the style and not go over the top once in a while.

Bottle at the Febmergency tasting. Pours golden orange with soapy white head. The aroma is spicy hops, dried apricot, pepper, sourdough. The flavor is candied ginger, lemon, red tea, and a mild earthy spice that seems kind of like yarrow. Pretty decent.

Bottle at decaturstevos Februmergency  Tasting for those of us that missed out on Sexual Chocolate 09.  Clear amber pour with fair white head that fades to a ring.  Nose is sweet, toasty malt, with a hint of alcohol.  Very sweet grain flavor with some alcohol.  The abv seems much higher than 4.5%   Good for the style I suppose, but it doesnt really do much for me otherwise.  As with all FFF, awesome label art.

Clear dull pale golden hue covered by minimal head. Very timid aroma mostly focuses on faint brady notes. (22oz bottle)  Pours a lightly hazy golden body with a small white head.  Aroma of grass, corn grain, and light florals.  Flavor of toasted grain, toffee, caramel malt, nuts, and mild hops (some floral, light grass) with a moderately dry finish.

22oz bottle - Pours lightly hazy yellow with a one finger fizzy head.  The aroma is biscuit malt and citrus notes.  The flavor is sweet bready malt with some good fruit character and mild hops.  Its light, refreshing, and a very enjoyable example of the style.  That said, I dont expect to pay so much for a good session brew.  This one should be one of their regular 6-pack releases, not a pricey bomber.  It’s a touch underrated here and the price point may be why.

bottle , thanks to bu11zeye, golden colored pour with no head, aroma is sweet and grainy, flavors of light fruit and a light finish

Like LiebeBier Im shocked by how this beer is being sold short.  Pours a warm copper color from the bomber with a light tan head.  Classic flavors of yeast malt caramel and mild orange citrus.  Belongs in a large dimpled mug next to a plate of German food.  Stop hating.
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Pour with a small, white head that fades covering a clear deep golden body. Aroma is sweet with cereal, corn, and DMS. Taste is sweet with cereal. Light carbonation.

bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  fruits, malts and bread with alcohol.  forgot to rate the appearance.  not bad on the palate with a nice hop flavor and a fruity finish, pretty good helles.

Pours crystal clear golden with a thin off white head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is slightly sweet very style appropriate malth with a faint hint of hops.  Nice carb bite and light crisp hops in the finish.  Body is a bit sweet with some toasty malts.  Nice crisp beer all around.

The aroma is a citrusy, buttery, hoppy, classic German dortmunder bouquet that really grows on you. GABF 2008. Bright gold, firm white head. Aroma of clean pale malts, apple-pear accent. Palate delivers the same, with a very clean finish of medium bitterness. Quite refreshing.

My Bottom Line:
This modest Helles proposes lightly toasted malts and feeble hoppiness enlivened by a soft prickling for a polite but mostly forgettable session.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam surrounds the hazy blond.
-The malt character is not very "Franconian" at all, and the hoppiness is not well developed enough for me to know what its trying to offer. Could be a freshness issue too?
-The subtle cereal sweetness is sometimes approached by watery notions.
-A distant citrusy spiciness comes from the hops.
-This is not very authentic and lacks inspiration, but it remains a clean and quaffable example of the style.

The nose is quite malty, plenty of pils notes, cracker crumbs. Restrained hopping. On taste, full and bready. Very refreshing and spot on for a helles. Vast improvement and very enjoyable.

Pours a slightly hazed pale golden with a small white. Aroma is medium sweet with some grass, light fruit and bread. Flavor is bread, fruit, light grass and light citrus. Light body, very clean texture.

Bottle via brewblack hole.  Golden color.  Smell of bread, yeast, hops, citrus and minor flowers. Tastes the same.  Wish they over hopped this beer like they do with most of their brews.

Pale yellow body with a large fluffy white head. The aroma is musky perfume with some grass. The taste has some light grassy notes and sweet apples. A long lingering finish. Decent, but a little sweet.

OK  Helles.  Light yellow pour with minimal head.  Aroma of wheat, bready and maybe a little banana.  Taste is malty but not much body.  a little watery.  Not one of FFFs best efforts.
